title: cmake version is chosen prior to package's version
body:
Looks like for `CMakePackage` concretizer fist settles on `cmake` version and only then tries to choose version of the root package. This may lead to failures in concretization if the root package has extra constraints based on its version.

Example is `dealii`. Current stable release is `8.5.1` which needs `cmake@3.9.x`, but if we try `spack spec dealii` it will fail with 

```
dealii requires cmake version :3.9.99, but spec asked for 3.10.1
```

The simplest workaround is to be explicit with versions, i.e. do `spack spec dealii@8.5.1`, but it would be better to have some fix in the order in which dependencies are concretized.
I simply can't explain why Spack would choose `cmake` version prior to chosing the latest stable version of `dealii`.

### Expected Result

Spack should concretize default build of `dealii`.

### Actual Result

```
dealii requires cmake version :3.9.99, but spec asked for 3.10.1
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec dealii
...
```

### Information on your system

Linux/macOS.
